content:
TITLE: Creating a WaveSurfer instance with options
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a wavesurfer instance with configuration options including container selector, colors, and audio URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const wavesurfer = WaveSurfer.create({
  container: '#waveform',
  waveColor: '#4F4A85',
  progressColor: '#383351',
  url: '/audio.mp3',
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing wavesurfer.js in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import the WaveSurfer class from the wavesurfer.js package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import WaveSurfer from 'wavesurfer.js'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing wavesurfer.js with npm
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to install wavesurfer.js using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install --save wavesurfer.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing a wavesurfer.js plugin with ES modules
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import a plugin (Regions) using ES modules syntax, for use with module bundlers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import Regions from 'wavesurfer.js/dist/plugins/regions.esm.js'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including wavesurfer.js with HTML script tag
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to include wavesurfer.js using a UMD script tag, which exports the library as a global WaveSurfer variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/wavesurfer.js@7"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including a wavesurfer.js plugin with HTML script tag
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to include a plugin using a script tag, which exports the plugin as a property of the global WaveSurfer object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/wavesurfer.js@7/dist/plugins/regions.min.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Styling wavesurfer.js elements with CSS
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to style wavesurfer.js elements using CSS ::part() pseudo-selector to access elements within the Shadow DOM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
#waveform ::part(cursor):before {
  content: 'üèÑ';
}
#waveform ::part(region) {
  font-family: fantasy;
}
```
